00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_logic.h -- C++ implementation of logic type. Behaves
00023                 pretty much the same way as HDLs except with 4 values.
00024 
00025   Original Author: Stan Y. Liao, Synopsys, Inc.
00026 
00027  *****************************************************************************/

00080 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 //  ENUM : sc_logic_value_t
00082 //
00083 //  Enumeration of values for sc_logic.
00084 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 
00086 enum sc_logic_value_t
00087 {
00088     Log_0 = 0,
00089     Log_1,
00090     Log_Z,
00091     Log_X
00092 };
00093 
00094 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00095 //  CLASS : sc_logic
00096 //
00097 //  Four-valued logic type.
00098 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099 
00100 class SC_API sc_logic
00101 {
00102 private:
00103 
00104     // support methods
00105 
00106     static void invalid_value( sc_logic_value_t );
00107     static void invalid_value( char );
00108     static void invalid_value( int );
00109 
00110     static sc_logic_value_t to_value( sc_logic_value_t v )
00111         {
00112             if( v < Log_0 || v > Log_X ) {
00113                 invalid_value( v );
00114                 // may continue, if suppressed
00115                 v = Log_X;
00116             }
00117             return v;
00118         }
00119 
00120     static sc_logic_value_t to_value( bool b )
00121         { return ( b ? Log_1 : Log_0 ); }
00122 
00123     static sc_logic_value_t to_value( char c )
00124         {
00125             unsigned int index = (int)c;
00126             if ( index > 127 )
00127             {
00128                 invalid_value( c );
00129                 // may continue, if suppressed
00130                 index = 127; // aka Log_X
00131             }
00132             return char_to_logic[index];
00133         }
00134 
00135     static sc_logic_value_t to_value( int i )
00136         {
00137             if( i < Log_0 || i > Log_X ) {
00138                 invalid_value( i );
00139                 // may continue, if suppressed
00140                 i = Log_X;
00141             }
00142             return sc_logic_value_t( i );
00143         }
00144 
00145 
00146     void invalid_01() const;
00147 
00148 public:
00149 
00150     // conversion tables
00151 
00152     static const sc_logic_value_t char_to_logic[128];
00153     static const char logic_to_char[4];
00154     static const sc_logic_value_t and_table[4][4];
00155     static const sc_logic_value_t or_table[4][4];
00156     static const sc_logic_value_t xor_table[4][4];
00157     static const sc_logic_value_t not_table[4];
00158 
00159 
00160     // constructors
00161 
00162     sc_logic()
00163         : m_val( Log_X )
00164         {}
00165 
00166     sc_logic( const sc_logic& a )
00167         : m_val( a.m_val )
00168         {}
00169 
00170     sc_logic( sc_logic_value_t v )
00171         : m_val( to_value( v ) )
00172         {}
00173 
00174     explicit sc_logic( bool a )
00175         : m_val( to_value( a ) )
00176         {}
00177 
00178     explicit sc_logic( char a )
00179         : m_val( to_value( a ) )
00180         {}
00181 
00182     explicit sc_logic( int a )
00183         : m_val( to_value( a ) )
00184         {}
00185 
00186     explicit sc_logic( const sc_bit& a )
00187         : m_val( to_value( a.to_bool() ) )
00188         {}
00189 
00190 
00191     // destructor
00192 
00193     ~sc_logic()
00194         {}
00195 
00196 
00197     // (bitwise) assignment operators
00198 
00199 #define DEFN_ASN_OP_T(op,tp)                       \
00200     sc_logic& operator op ( tp v )                 \
00201         { *this op sc_logic( v ); return *this; }
00202 
00203 #define DEFN_ASN_OP(op)                            \
00204     DEFN_ASN_OP_T(op, sc_logic_value_t)            \
00205     DEFN_ASN_OP_T(op, bool)                        \
00206     DEFN_ASN_OP_T(op, char)                        \
00207     DEFN_ASN_OP_T(op, int )                        \
00208     DEFN_ASN_OP_T(op, const sc_bit& )
00209 
00210     sc_logic& operator = ( const sc_logic& a )
00211         { m_val = a.m_val; return *this; }
00212 
00213     sc_logic& operator &= ( const sc_logic& b )
00214         { m_val = and_table[m_val][b.m_val]; return *this; }
00215 
00216     sc_logic& operator |= ( const sc_logic& b )
00217         { m_val = or_table[m_val][b.m_val]; return *this; }
00218 
00219     sc_logic& operator ^= ( const sc_logic& b )
00220         { m_val = xor_table[m_val][b.m_val]; return *this; }
00221 
00222     DEFN_ASN_OP(=)
00223     DEFN_ASN_OP(&=)
00224     DEFN_ASN_OP(|=)
00225     DEFN_ASN_OP(^=)
00226 
00227 #undef DEFN_ASN_OP_T
00228 #undef DEFN_ASN_OP
00229 
00230 
00231     // bitwise operators and functions
00232 
00233 
00234     friend const sc_logic operator & ( const sc_logic&, const sc_logic& );
00235     friend const sc_logic operator | ( const sc_logic&, const sc_logic& );
00236     friend const sc_logic operator ^ ( const sc_logic&, const sc_logic& );
00237 
00238     // relational operators
00239 
00240     friend bool operator == ( const sc_logic&, const sc_logic& );
00241     friend bool operator != ( const sc_logic&, const sc_logic& );
00242 
00243     // bitwise complement
00244 
00245     const sc_logic operator ~ () const
00246         { return sc_logic( not_table[m_val] ); }
00247 
00248     sc_logic& b_not()
00249         { m_val = not_table[m_val]; return *this; }
00250 
00251 
00252     // explicit conversions
00253 
00254     sc_logic_value_t value() const
00255         { return m_val; }
00256 
00257 
00258     bool is_01() const
00259         { return ( (int) m_val == Log_0 || (int) m_val == Log_1 ); }
00260 
00261     bool to_bool() const
00262         { if( ! is_01() ) { invalid_01(); } return ( (int) m_val != Log_0 ); }
00263 
00264     char to_char() const
00265         { return logic_to_char[m_val]; }
00266 
00267 
00268     // other methods
00269 
00270     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00271         { os << to_char(); }
00272 
00273     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
00274 
00275 
00276     // memory (de)allocation
00277 
00278     static void* operator new( std::size_t, void* p ) // placement new
00279         { return p; }
00280 
00281     static void* operator new( std::size_t sz )
00282         { return sc_core::sc_mempool::allocate( sz ); }
00283 
00284     static void operator delete( void* p, std::size_t sz )
00285         { sc_core::sc_mempool::release( p, sz ); }
00286 
00287     static void* operator new [] ( std::size_t sz )
00288         { return sc_core::sc_mempool::allocate( sz ); }
00289 
00290     static void operator delete [] ( void* p, std::size_t sz )
00291         { sc_core::sc_mempool::release( p, sz ); }
00292 
00293 private:
00294 
00295     sc_logic_value_t m_val;
00296 
00297 private:
00298 
00299     // disabled
00300     explicit sc_logic( const char* );
00301     sc_logic& operator = ( const char* );
00302 };
00303 
00304 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00305 
00306 // bitwise operators
00307 
00308 inline const sc_logic operator & ( const sc_logic& a, const sc_logic& b )
00309        { return sc_logic( sc_logic::and_table[a.m_val][b.m_val] ); }
00310 
00311 inline const sc_logic operator | ( const sc_logic& a, const sc_logic& b )
00312        { return sc_logic( sc_logic::or_table[a.m_val][b.m_val] ); }
00313 
00314 inline const sc_logic operator ^ ( const sc_logic& a, const sc_logic& b )
00315        { return sc_logic( sc_logic::xor_table[a.m_val][b.m_val] ); }
00316 
00317 #define DEFN_BIN_OP_T(ret,op,tp)                       \
00318     inline ret operator op ( const sc_logic& a, tp b ) \
00319         { return ( a op sc_logic( b ) ); }             \
00320     inline ret operator op ( tp a, const sc_logic& b ) \
00321         { return ( sc_logic( a ) op b ); }
00322 
00323 #define DEFN_BIN_OP(ret,op)                            \
00324     DEFN_BIN_OP_T(ret,op,sc_logic_value_t)             \
00325     DEFN_BIN_OP_T(ret,op,bool)                         \
00326     DEFN_BIN_OP_T(ret,op,char)                         \
00327     DEFN_BIN_OP_T(ret,op,int)
00328 
00329 DEFN_BIN_OP(const sc_logic,&)
00330 DEFN_BIN_OP(const sc_logic,|)
00331 DEFN_BIN_OP(const sc_logic,^)
00332 
00333 // relational operators and functions
00334 
00335 inline bool operator == ( const sc_logic& a, const sc_logic& b )
00336        { return ( (int) a.m_val == b.m_val ); }
00337 
00338 inline bool operator != ( const sc_logic& a, const sc_logic& b )
00339        { return ( (int) a.m_val != b.m_val ); }
00340 
00341 DEFN_BIN_OP(bool,==)
00342 DEFN_BIN_OP(bool,!=)
00343 
00344 #undef DEFN_BIN_OP_T
00345 #undef DEFN_BIN_OP
00346 
00347 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

00349 inline
00350 ::std::ostream&
00351 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_logic& a )
00352 {
00353     a.print( os );
00354     return os;
00355 }
00356 
00357 inline
00358 ::std::istream&
00359 operator >> ( ::std::istream& is, sc_logic& a )
00360 {
00361     a.scan( is );
00362     return is;
00363 }
